se.vxu.msi.malteval.grouping
Interface Grouping

All Superinterfaces:
Metric
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArcDepth, ArcDirection, ArcProjectivity, BranchingFactor, Clustering, Clustering2, ComplexGrouping, Cpostag, Deprel, EndWordPosition, Feats, Frame, GroupedRelationLength, Lemma, Postag, PreAndPost, RelationLength, RelativeWordPosition, Sentence, SentenceAndToken, SentenceLength, StartWordPosition, Token, Wordform
public interface Grouping
extends Metric

All grouping strategies must implement this interface.

Author:
Jens Nilsson (jens.nilsson@msi.vxu.se)

getSecondName, isCorrect
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize()
MaltEval creates once instance of each class that implements Grouping. This method is called once right after creation, and can contain anything that is useful for the other methods when they are called during the evaluation. Creating the Vectors that are returned by getValidAttributes() and getDefaultAttributes() could, among other things be done here.

Specified by:
initialize in interface Metric

getKey

java.lang.Object getKey(MaltSentence sentence,
                        int wordIndex)
Parameters:
sentence - The sentence that is processed for the moment
wordIndex - The index of the word processed for the moment. The virtual root the the sentence has index 0.
Returns:
The key that represents the sentence and word index.

isComplexGroupItem

boolean isComplexGroupItem()
Indicates whether this grouping strategy can be part of a complex grouping strategy. If you don't know what a complex grouping strategy is, then put the line return false; as the only statement in this method.

Returns:
true or false depending on whether this grouping strategy could be part of a complex grouping or not.

postProcess

DataContainer postProcess(DataContainer dataContainer)
This method is called when the evaluation for this grouping is completed for each parsed file. In the usual case, the input argument is simply returned, but in more complicated grouping strategies (i.e. the the grouping ErrorPropagation), the evaluation data is further processed.

Parameters:
dataContainer - The evaluation data created using a grouping strategy
Returns:
A DataContainer containing the post processed data

showTableHeader

boolean showTableHeader()
This method is called when the table containing the data is created. If this methods return true, the column headers and aggregation data (Row mean and Row count) is displayed.

Returns:
If this methods return true, the column headers and aggregation data (Row mean and Row count) is displayed.

showDetails

boolean showDetails()
This method is called when the table containing the data is created. If this methods return true, the column headers and aggregation data (Row mean and Row count) is displayed. This value can be overridden by the flag --details

Returns:
If this methods return true, the detailed table info is shown.

getSelfMetricName

java.lang.String getSelfMetricName()
In case the metric flag is given the value "self", then the returned string of this method is shown in the header of the evaluation output for Metric. Use return getClass().getSimpleName(); as the only statement of this methods if you don't have good reasons not to.

Returns:
The self metric name. Usually the the name of the class itself should be used.

correspondingMetric

java.lang.String correspondingMetric()
This method has a special meaning for some of the grouping strategies that are comes with MaltEval for backward compatibility. All new grouping strategies can safely type return null; here.

Returns:
null

isSimpleAccuracyGrouping

boolean isSimpleAccuracyGrouping()
MaltEval can not for the moment determine whether a grouping strategy is only able to produce accuracy, or if the result must be divided into for instance precision and recall. This method should contain either the line return true; or return false;.

Returns:
true or false, where true means that is does not make sense to divide the evaluation into precision and recall.
